ground_truth: Jack kisses the tickets and hugs Fabrizio as Olaf throttles Sven. Fabrizio quickly sweeps the winnings into Jack's cap. Later, the two young men run along the dock. Jack and Fabrizio run up a gangplank. Carrying sacks over their shoulders, Jack and Fabrizio dash into the ship. They run onto one of the upper decks and wave to arm lockers from a railing. Black smoke belches from one of the Titanic's four stacks. Hundreds of passengers wave to the people on the dock below as tugboats pull the Titanic away from the shore. Turning up clouds of silt on the dock, a bearded man turns a crank on a movie camera as the ship glides forward. White seagulls appear no larger than insects as they flutter past the Titanic's massive crowd. Four rows of portholes line the sides of the ocean liner, which glides past a small two-manned sailboat. Inside the Titanic, a brown-haired woman herds a young boy and girl up a corridor. Jack and Fabrizio pass in the opposite direction. Jack enters a berth, and Jack's roommates exchange puzzled looks. In her cabin, Rose unpacks a painting. A porter carries in a pair of suitcases as Cal enters from the adjoining promenade deck. As a porter wheels in a safe on a dolly, Cal jams a bottle of champagne into an ice bucket. As the Titanic cruises in open water, the white-bearded captain steps up beside the first officer. Murdoch strides into the wheelhouse. Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room, and the needle on an identical machine moves to the same position. Men dash along catwalks as turning gears pump huge pistons up and down. The mustached foreman turns the wheel connected to several steam pipes in the smokey boiler room, which is covered in coal from large furnaces. A needle rises on a steam pressure gauge. Pumping pistons move faster and faster, slicing through the ocean. On deck, Jack and Fabrizio growl against the railing. Behind them, Captain Smith stands on the uppermost deck outside the pilot hub. First Officer Murdoch steps up beside him, and the captain glances at him and grins. Jack points towards something below, where a dolphin swims ahead of the ship. Other dolphins join the first one, zooming through the clear water like zig-zagging torpedoes. One dolphin leaps out of the water. Jack smiles as he gazes down at the dolphins, and behind them, a crew member hands a teacup to Captain Smith. He sips his drink while gazing out to sea. From the boiler room, men dump wheelbarrows of coal beside stokers who shovel the fuel. An engineer leans over a railing as massive pistons pump on either side of it.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Jack pecks the passes and embraces Fabrizio as Olaf chokes Sven. Fabrizio swiftly scoops the prizes into Jack's hat. Later, the two youthful males sprint along the pier. Jack and Fabrizio race up a gangway. Bearing bags over their backs, Jack and Fabrizio rush into the vessel. They dash onto one of the upper platforms and wave to weapon lockers from a banister. Dark smoke erupts from one of the Titanic's four chimneys. Hundreds of travelers wave to the individuals on the dock below as tugboats tow the Titanic away from the coast. Stirring up clouds of sediment on the pier, a whiskered man turns a crank on a film camera as the ship slides ahead. White gulls emerge no larger than bugs as they flutter past the Titanic's colossal gathering. Four lines of windows border the sides of the ocean cruiser, which glides past a small two-manned sailboat. Inside the Titanic, a brunette woman herds a young boy and girl up a hallway. Jack and Fabrizio go by in the contrary direction. Jack enters a cabin, and Jack's roommates trade baffled glances. In her chamber, Rose unpacks a portrait. A porter carries in a pair of bags as Cal enters from the adjacent promenade deck. As a porter wheels in a safe on a cart, Cal jams a bottle of champagne into an ice container. As the Titanic sails in open sea, the white-bearded captain steps up beside the first officer. Murdoch strides into the wheelhouse. Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room, and the needle on an identical instrument shifts to the same position. Men sprint along walkways as revolving gears pump giant pistons up and down. The mustached supervisor turns the wheel connected to several steam pipes in the smoky boiler room, which is covered in coal from large furnaces. A needle ascends on a steam pressure gauge. Pumping pistons move more rapidly, slicing through the ocean. On deck, Jack and Fabrizio growl against the railing. Behind them, Captain Smith stands on the topmost deck outside the pilot house. First Officer Murdoch steps up beside him, and the captain glances at him and grins. Jack points towards something below, where a dolphin swims ahead of the vessel. Other dolphins join the first one, zooming through the clear water like zig-zagging torpedoes. One dolphin leaps out of the water. Jack smiles as he gazes down at the dolphins, and behind them, a crew member hands a teacup to Captain Smith. He sips his drink while gazing out to sea. From the boiler room, men dump wheelbarrows of coal beside stokers who shovel the fuel. An engineer leans over a railing as massive pistons pump on either side of it.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The tickets are kissed by Jack, and Fabrizio is hugged by him as Sven is throttled by Olaf. The winnings are quickly swept into Jack's cap by Fabrizio. Later, the dock is run along by the two young men. A gangplank is run up by Jack and Fabrizio. Sacks are carried over their shoulders as the ship is dashed into by Jack and Fabrizio. The upper decks are run onto by them, and arm lockers are waved to from a railing. Black smoke is belched by one of the Titanic's four stacks. The people on the dock below are waved to by hundreds of passengers as the tugboats pull the Titanic away from the shore. A crank is turned on a movie camera by a bearded man, while clouds of silt are turned up on the dock as the ship glides forward. No larger than insects, white seagulls appear as they are fluttered past by the Titanic's massive crowd. Lines of portholes are formed by four rows, lining the sides of the ocean liner, which glides past a small two-manned sailboat. A brown-haired woman herds a young boy and girl up a corridor inside the Titanic. Jack and Fabrizio pass in the opposite direction. Puzzled looks are exchanged by Jack's roommates as a berth is entered by Jack. In her cabin, a painting is unpacked by Rose. A pair of suitcases is carried in by a porter as Cal enters from the adjoining promenade deck. As a safe is wheeled in on a dolly by a porter, Cal jams a bottle of champagne into an ice bucket. In open water, the white-bearded captain steps up beside the first officer as the Titanic is cruised. The wheelhouse is strode into by Murdoch. Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room, and an identical machine's needle moves to the same position. Catwalks are dashed along by men as huge pistons are pumped up and down by turning gears. The wheel connected to several steam pipes is turned by the mustached foreman in the smokey boiler room, which the coal from large furnaces covers. On a steam pressure gauge, a needle rises. Faster and faster, pistons are pumped, slicing through the ocean. Against the railing, Jack and Fabrizio growl on deck. Captain Smith stands behind them on the uppermost deck outside the pilot hub. Beside him steps First Officer Murdoch, and he is glanced at and grinned at by the captain. Something below is pointed at by Jack, where a dolphin is swimming ahead of the ship. The first dolphin is joined by other dolphins, zooming through the clear water like zig-zagging torpedoes. Out of the water, one dolphin leaps. Jack smiles as the dolphins are gazed at by him, and behind them, a teacup is handed to Captain Smith by a crew member. His drink is sipped as the sea is gazed out at by him. From the boiler room, wheelbarrows of coal are dumped beside stokers who shovel the fuel. Leaning over a railing, an engineer observes as massive pistons pump on either side of it.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Jack, filled with excitement and joy, kisses the precious tickets and embraces his friend Fabrizio warmly, while nearby, Olaf playfully throttles Sven. With swift and practiced movements, Fabrizio quickly gathers the winnings and places them into Jack's cap. Later on, the two young men, full of energy and anticipation, sprint along the bustling dock. Jack and Fabrizio eagerly make their way up a gangplank, carrying sacks slung over their shoulders. They dash into the grand ship, their hearts racing with excitement. Once on one of the upper decks, they enthusiastically wave to the arm lockers from a railing. Meanwhile, thick black smoke billows from one of the Titanic's four towering stacks. Hundreds of passengers, filled with a mix of excitement and nostalgia, wave to the people gathered on the dock below as tugboats begin to pull the majestic Titanic away from the shore. As the ship glides forward, turning up clouds of silt on the dock, a bearded man diligently turns a crank on a movie camera, capturing the momentous occasion. White seagulls, appearing no larger than tiny insects, flutter gracefully past the Titanic's massive crowd. Four rows of portholes line the sides of the grand ocean liner, which glides smoothly past a small, two-manned sailboat. Inside the Titanic, a brown-haired woman gently herds a young boy and girl up a corridor, while Jack and Fabrizio pass by in the opposite direction. Jack enters a berth, and his roommates exchange puzzled looks, trying to make sense of the new arrival. In her cabin, Rose carefully unpacks a painting, while a porter carries in a pair of suitcases. Cal enters from the adjoining promenade deck, and as a porter wheels in a safe on a dolly, Cal confidently jams a bottle of champagne into an ice bucket. As the Titanic cruises through the open water, the white-bearded captain steps up beside the first officer. Murdoch strides purposefully into the wheelhouse, and Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room, causing the needle on an identical machine to move to the same position. Men dash along catwalks as turning gears pump huge pistons up and down with rhythmic precision. The mustached foreman turns the wheel connected to several steam pipes in the smoky boiler room, which is covered in coal from the large furnaces. A needle rises steadily on a steam pressure gauge. Pumping pistons move faster and faster, slicing through the ocean with increasing speed. On deck, Jack and Fabrizio lean against the railing, growling playfully. Behind them, Captain Smith stands on the uppermost deck outside the pilot hub. First Officer Murdoch steps up beside him, and the captain glances at him with a grin. Jack points excitedly towards something below, where a dolphin swims gracefully ahead of the ship. Other dolphins soon join the first one, zooming through the clear water like zig-zagging torpedoes. One dolphin leaps out of the water, and Jack smiles as he gazes down at the playful creatures. Behind them, a crew member hands a teacup to Captain Smith, who sips his drink while gazing out to sea. In the boiler room, men tirelessly dump wheelbarrows of coal beside stokers who shovel the fuel with determination. An engineer leans over a railing, observing as massive pistons pump on either side of it.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Jack, utterly overflowing with excitement and sheer joy, passionately kisses the precious tickets, embracing his friend Fabrizio with genuine warmth and affection. Nearby, in the lively atmosphere, Olaf playfully throttles Sven. Using swift and skillful motions honed by experience, Fabrizio efficiently gathers all the winnings and places them carefully into Jack's cap. Later on, the two young men, bursting with energy and anticipation, sprint eagerly along the bustling dock. Driven by excitement, Jack and Fabrizio enthusiastically make their way up the gangplank, carrying sacks securely slung over their shoulders. They dash eagerly into the grand and magnificent ship, their hearts racing with the thrill of the moment. Once stationed on one of the upper decks, they enthusiastically wave to the arm lockers from a nearby railing. Meanwhile, thick, dark black smoke billows ominously from one of the Titanic's four towering stacks. Hundreds of passengers, filled with a complex mix of excitement and nostalgia, wave energetically to the vast crowd of people gathered on the dock below, as tugboats begin to pull the majestic Titanic away from the shore. As the ship glides majestically forward, stirring up clouds of silt on the dock, a bearded man diligently turns a crank on a movie camera, capturing this momentous occasion for posterity. White seagulls, appearing no larger than tiny insects from afar, flutter gracefully past the massive crowd aboard the Titanic. Four rows of portholes line the grand ocean liner's sides, which glides smoothly past a small, two-manned sailboat. Inside the Titanic, a brown-haired woman gently herds a young boy and girl along a corridor, while Jack and Fabrizio pass by in the opposite direction, eagerly exploring the ship. Jack enters a berth, and his new roommates exchange puzzled and curious looks, trying to make sense of the unexpected new arrival. In her cabin, Rose carefully unpacks an exquisite painting, while a porter dutifully carries in a pair of heavy suitcases. Cal enters from the adjoining promenade deck, and as a porter wheels in a safe on a dolly, Cal confidently jams a bottle of champagne into an ice bucket, showing off his nonchalance. As the Titanic cruises smoothly through the open water, the white-bearded Captain Smith steps up beside the first officer. Murdoch strides purposefully into the wheelhouse, and Moody deftly pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room, causing the needle on an identical machine to move to the same position. Men dash purposefully along catwalks as turning gears pump huge pistons up and down with rhythmic precision. The mustached foreman turns the wheel connected to several steam pipes in the smoky boiler room, which is coated in coal dust from the large furnaces. A needle on a steam pressure gauge rises steadily. Pumping pistons move faster and faster, slicing dynamically through the ocean with increasing speed. On deck, Jack and Fabrizio lean casually against the railing, growling playfully like spirited youngsters. Behind them, Captain Smith stands on the uppermost deck outside the pilot hub. First Officer Murdoch steps up beside him, and the captain glances at him with a knowing grin. Jack points excitedly towards something below, where a dolphin swims gracefully ahead of the ship. Other dolphins soon join the first one, zooming through the clear, sparkling water like zig-zagging torpedoes. One dolphin leaps joyfully out of the water, and Jack smiles as he gazes down at the playful creatures with delight. Behind them, a crew member hands a delicate teacup to Captain Smith, who sips his drink while gazing thoughtfully out to sea. In the boiler room, men tirelessly dump wheelbarrows full of coal beside stokers who shovel the fuel with unwavering determination. An engineer leans over a railing, observing intently as massive pistons pump on either side of it, marveling at the ship's engineering prowess.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jack, filled with excitement, presses his lips against the tickets, savoring the moment, and then wraps his arms around Fabrizio in a joyful embrace. Meanwhile, Olaf, in a fit of playful aggression, grips Sven's neck with his hands. Fabrizio, acting swiftly, gathers the winnings with a sweeping motion and deposits them into Jack's cap. Later, the scene shifts to the two young men, Jack and Fabrizio, who are now sprinting along the dock with eager anticipation. Their feet pound against the wooden planks as they approach the gangplank, which they ascend with quick, determined strides. With sacks slung over their shoulders, they dash into the ship, their excitement palpable. They make their way onto one of the upper decks, where they lean over the railing, energetically waving to the arm lockers below. As they do so, black smoke begins to pour from one of the Titanic's four towering stacks, signaling the ship's imminent departure. Hundreds of passengers, filled with a mix of excitement and nostalgia, wave to the people gathered on the dock below as tugboats begin to pull the Titanic away from the shore. The movement stirs up clouds of silt on the dock, where a bearded man stands, turning the crank of a movie camera to capture the historic moment as the ship glides forward. Above, white seagulls, appearing no larger than tiny insects, flutter past the Titanic's massive crowd. The ocean liner, with its four rows of portholes lining its sides, glides majestically past a small two-manned sailboat. Inside the Titanic, a brown-haired woman, with a gentle yet firm demeanor, herds a young boy and girl up a corridor, guiding them with care. Jack and Fabrizio, moving in the opposite direction, pass by them with a sense of purpose. Jack then enters a berth, where his roommates exchange puzzled looks, their expressions a mix of curiosity and confusion. In another part of the ship, Rose is in her cabin, carefully unpacking a painting with delicate hands. A porter enters, carrying a pair of suitcases, and shortly after, Cal makes his entrance from the adjoining promenade deck. As another porter wheels in a safe on a dolly, Cal, with a sense of satisfaction, jams a bottle of champagne into an ice bucket, preparing for a celebratory moment. As the Titanic cruises through open water, the white-bearded captain steps up beside the first officer, exuding an air of authority and experience. Murdoch strides confidently into the wheelhouse, where Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room, causing the needle on an identical machine to move to the same position. In response, men dash along catwalks, their movements synchronized with the turning gears that pump huge pistons up and down. In the smokey boiler room, the mustached foreman turns a wheel connected to several steam pipes, his hands blackened with coal from the large furnaces. A needle rises steadily on a steam pressure gauge, indicating the increasing power. The pumping pistons move faster and faster, slicing through the ocean with relentless force. On deck, Jack and Fabrizio lean against the railing, growling playfully as they take in the vast expanse of the sea. Behind them, Captain Smith stands on the uppermost deck outside the pilot hub, observing the scene with a sense of pride. First Officer Murdoch steps up beside him, and the captain glances at him, a grin spreading across his face. Jack, filled with wonder, points towards something below, where a dolphin swims gracefully ahead of the ship. Other dolphins join the first one, zooming through the clear water like zig-zagging torpedoes, their sleek bodies cutting through the waves. One dolphin leaps out of the water, its form momentarily suspended in the air. Jack smiles, his eyes fixed on the dolphins, captivated by their beauty. Behind them, a crew member hands a teacup to Captain Smith, who sips his drink while gazing out to sea, his mind perhaps reflecting on the journey ahead. In the boiler room, men work tirelessly, dumping wheelbarrows of coal beside stokers who shovel the fuel with rhythmic precision. An engineer leans over a railing, observing the massive pistons that pump on either side of it, their relentless motion a testament to the ship's power and engineering marvel.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jack celebrates their win by kissing the tickets and hugging Fabrizio, while Olaf throttles Sven. Fabrizio quickly gathers the winnings into Jack's cap. Later, the two young men sprint along the dock, up a gangplank, and into the ship, carrying sacks over their shoulders. They reach an upper deck and wave to onlookers as black smoke billows from one of the Titanic's stacks. Passengers wave to those on the dock as tugboats pull the Titanic away. A bearded man cranks a movie camera, capturing the ship's departure, while seagulls flutter past the massive crowd. The ocean liner, lined with portholes, glides past a small sailboat. Inside, a woman guides two children up a corridor, passing Jack and Fabrizio. Jack enters a berth, surprising his roommates. In her cabin, Rose unpacks a painting as Cal enters, and a porter brings in luggage and a safe. Cal places a champagne bottle in an ice bucket. As the Titanic cruises in open water, Captain Smith joins the first officer on deck. Murdoch enters the wheelhouse, and Moody adjusts the telegraph lever, prompting men to work in the engine room. The foreman operates steam pipes, increasing steam pressure and speeding up the pistons. On deck, Jack and Fabrizio lean against the railing, watching dolphins swim ahead of the ship. Captain Smith, sipping tea, observes the sea. In the boiler room, men shovel coal, and an engineer oversees the massive pistons.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Jack kisses the tickets and hugs Fabrizio as Olaf, known for his towering stature and strength on the docks, throttles Sven. Fabrizio quickly sweeps the winnings into Jack's cap, celebrating their recent victory at the card game they played to secure passage. Later, the two young men run along the dock bustling with activity. Jack and Fabrizio run up a gangplank, the Titanic’s main boarding ramp for third-class passengers. Carrying sacks over their shoulders, filled with their modest belongings, Jack and Fabrizio dash into the ship. They run onto one of the upper decks and wave to arm lockers, the officers assigned to secure the passengers' firearms, from a railing. Black smoke belches from one of the Titanic's four stacks, each connected to the ship’s massive steam engines. Hundreds of passengers wave to the people on the dock below as tugboats, vital for steering such a massive vessel in tight quarters, pull the Titanic away from the shore. Turning up clouds of silt on the dock, a bearded man turns a crank on a movie camera, an invention still novel and fascinating in 1912, as the ship glides forward. White seagulls appear no larger than insects as they flutter past the Titanic's massive crowd, which has drawn spectators from all over the city. Four rows of portholes line the sides of the ocean liner, the largest and most luxurious ship of its time, as it glides past a small two-manned sailboat, dwarfed by the Titanic's enormous size and grandeur. Inside the Titanic, a brown-haired woman, likely a third-class passenger based on her attire, herds a young boy and girl up a corridor. Jack and Fabrizio pass in the opposite direction, eager to explore their new surroundings. Jack enters a berth, surprising Jack's roommates who exchange puzzled looks, unused to sudden arrivals. In her cabin, Rose, a first-class passenger with refined tastes, unpacks a painting. A porter in a crisp uniform carries in a pair of suitcases as Cal, her wealthy fiancé, enters from the adjoining promenade deck, an exclusive area for first-class passengers. As a porter wheels in a safe on a dolly, Cal jams a bottle of champagne into an ice bucket, preparing for a luxurious journey. As the Titanic cruises in open water, the white-bearded Captain Smith, a seasoned seafarer nearing retirement, steps up beside the first officer. Murdoch strides into the wheelhouse, the nerve center of the ship's navigation. Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room, and the needle on an identical machine moves to the same position, signaling maximum speed. Men dash along catwalks as turning gears pump huge pistons up and down, powering the largest moving object built by man at the time. The mustached foreman turns the wheel connected to several steam pipes in the smokey boiler room, which is covered in coal from large furnaces, vital for maintaining the ship's speed. A needle rises on a steam pressure gauge, indicating increased power as pumping pistons move faster and faster, slicing through the ocean. On deck, Jack and Fabrizio growl against the railing, feeling the exhilarating rush of wind. Behind them, Captain Smith stands on the uppermost deck outside the pilot hub, overseeing the voyage with quiet confidence. First Officer Murdoch steps up beside him, and the captain glances at him and grins, sharing a moment of camaraderie. Jack points towards something below, where a dolphin swims ahead of the ship, a symbol of good fortune for sailors. Other dolphins join the first one, zooming through the clear water like zig-zagging torpedoes, their playful antics a temporary distraction from the journey ahead. One dolphin leaps out of the water, catching the light in a brief, dazzling display. Jack smiles as he gazes down at the dolphins, and behind them, a crew member hands a teacup to Captain Smith, who sips his drink while gazing out to sea, savoring the calm before the challenges of the voyage. From the boiler room, men dump wheelbarrows of coal beside stokers who shovel the fuel, the backbreaking work essential to keep the Titanic's engines running. An engineer leans over a railing as massive pistons pump on either side of it, a testament to the ship’s innovative engineering.

Murdoch strides into the wheelhouse. Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room and the needle on an identical machine moves to the same position. Men dash along catwalks as turning gears pump huge pistons up and down. The mustached foreman turns the wheel connected to several steam pipes in the smokey boiler room which is covered in coal from large furnaces. A needle rises on a steam pressure gauge. Pumping pistons move faster and faster slicing through the ocean. On deck Jack and Fabrizio growl against the railing. Behind them Captain Smith stands on the uppermost deck outside the pilot hub. First Officer Murdoch steps up beside him and the captain glances at him and grins. Jack points towards something below where a dolphin swims ahead of the ship. Other dolphins join the first one zooming through the clear water like zigzagging torpedoes. One dolphin leaps out of the water. Jack smiles as he gazes down at the dolphins and behind them. a crew member hands a teacup to Captain Smith. He sips his drink while gazing out to sea. From the boiler room men dump wheelbarrows of coal beside stokers who shovel the fuel. An engineer leans over a railing as massive pistons pump on either side of it.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Jack kisses the tickets and hugs Fabrizio as Olaf throttles. Sven. Fabrizio quickly sweeps the winnings into Jack's cap. Later the two young men run along the dock. Jack and Fabrizio run up a gangplank. Carrying sacks over their shoulders Jack and Fabrizio dash into the ship. They run onto one of the upper decks and wave to arm lockers from a railing. Black smoke belches from one of the Titanic's four stacks. Hundreds of passengers wave to the people on the dock below as tugboats pull the Titanic away from the shore. Turning up clouds of silt on the dock. a bearded man turns a crank on a movie camera as the ship glides forward. White seagulls appear no larger than insects as they flutter past the Titanic's massive crowd. Four rows of portholes line the sides of the ocean liner which glides past a small twomanned sailboat. Inside the Titanic a brownhaired woman herds a young boy and girl up a corridor. Jack and Fabrizio pass in the opposite direction. Jack enters a berth and Jack's roommates exchange puzzled looks. In her cabin Rose unpacks a painting. A porter carries in a pair of suitcases as Cal enters from the adjoining promenade deck. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. As a porter wheels in a safe on a dolly Cal jams a bottle of champagne into an ice bucket. As the Titanic cruises in open water the whitebearded captain steps up beside the first officer. Murdoch strides into the wheelhouse. Moody pulls a telegraph lever to a head full in the engine room and the needle on an identical machine moves to the same position. Men dash along catwalks as turning gears pump huge pistons up and down. The mustached foreman turns the wheel connected to several steam pipes in the smokey boiler room which is covered in coal from large furnaces. A needle rises on a steam pressure gauge. Other dolphins join the first one zooming through the clear water like zigzagging torpedoes. One dolphin leaps out of the water. Jack smiles as he gazes down at the dolphins and behind them. a crew member hands a teacup to Captain Smith. He sips his drink while gazing out to sea. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Roger pats the apples and pokes Antonio as Greta tickles Lars. Antonio slowly collects the marbles into Roger's boot. Afterwards, the two elderly women skip beneath the bridge. Roger and Antonio climb down a ladder. Juggling balloons under their arms, Roger and Antonio stumble out of the bus. They jump onto one of the lower mounds and shout to tree branches from a fence. White steam spews from one of the Moon's seven towers. Dozens of astronauts shout to the stars on the field above as canoes push the Moon toward the sky. Stirring up mountains of dust on the field, a bald child spins a top on a music box as the bus slides backward. Blue butterflies appear no larger than raindrops as they flit past the Moon's tiny parade. Six columns of doors adorn the walls of the submarine, which drifts past a vast three-hummed hovercraft. Outside the Moon, a gray-haired cat shepherds an old dog and kitten down a staircase. Roger and Antonio stroll in the same direction. Roger exits a locker, and Roger's adversaries share embarrassed nods. In his bunker, Lily unfolds a sculpture. A gardener pushes in a trio of lanterns as Ben exits onto the adjacent observation tower. As a gardener rolls in a container on a trolley, Ben squeezes a loaf of bread into a lunchbox. As the Moon sails over the forest, the gray-haired wizard flies up beside the second singer. Hopkins trots into the lighthouse. Benson flips a valve handle to a tail empty in the cargo hold, and the dial on a matching device shifts to the corresponding mark. Robots leap over bridges as spinning wheels haul tiny levers sideways and vertically. The goateed mechanic twists the lever connected to several copper tubes in the misty engine room, which is draped in silk from enormous ovens. A pointer descends on a heat indicator. Swaying levers move slower and slower, floating above the islands. Below deck, Roger and Antonio bark beneath the canopy. In front of them, Pilot Lewis sits inside the lowest deck underneath the control tower. Second Officer Hopkins strides down beside her, and the pilot winks at her and frowns. Roger signals towards something above, where a turtle floats behind the bus. Other turtles gather with the first one, drifting through the muddy sky like sparkling comets. One turtle bounces from the sky. Roger frowns as he peers up at the turtles, and above them, a passenger hands a muffin to Pilot Lewis. She nibbles her snack while peering up at the sun. From the engine room, robots gather baskets of silk beside mechanics who toss the material. A scientist bends under a swing as tiny levers haul at either end of it.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jack kisses the tickets and embraces Fabrizio while Olaf throttles Sven. Fabrizio gathers the winnings into Jack's cap, and they both sprint to the Titanic, waving from the upper decks as tugboats pull the ship from shore. As a bearded man films the scene, seagulls flutter past the Titanic's colossal structure. Inside, a woman guides children down a corridor, passing Jack and Fabrizio. Meanwhile, Rose unpacks a painting in her cabin as Cal enters with champagne and a porter wheels in a safe. As the Titanic navigates open water, Captain Smith and First Officer Murdoch monitor the ship's course. Moody sets the engine room telegraph to full speed, prompting men to manage coal and steam pressure as pistons pump faster. Jack and Fabrizio enjoy the view, pointing at dolphins swimming alongside the ship. Captain Smith enjoys tea while observing the ocean, and crew members tirelessly maintain the ship's operations below deck.
